bio:treatment.description: Annuals or biennials (perennials with mild winters), 4–70 cm. Stems loosely strigose to sparsely hirsute, hirsuto-villous, or villous. Leaves: basal commonly withering by flowering, cauline faces sparsely hirsute to villous. 2n = 18.
Flowering (Feb–)Mar–Jun(–Aug, in ne United States, Canada, and high elevations).
Openings and margins of woods, marsh edges, creek sides, fields, roadsides, ditch banks, lawns, and other open, disturbed sites;
